meanings.definition: To give birth to a foal.
meanings.sent1: The mare foaled a beautiful baby horse.
meanings.sent2: The horse foaled in the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent3: The farm animals were surprised when the chicken foaled a tiny foal.
meanings.sent4: The fertile land seemed to foal new life with each passing season.
meanings.sent5: The miracle of nature was evident as the mare foaled effortlessly.

meanings.sent1: The farmer admired the strong legs of the foaled horse.
meanings.sent2: The foaled foal was a sight to behold in the meadow.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled at the playful antics of the foaled colt.
meanings.sent4: The foaled mare stood proudly next to her young foal.
meanings.sent5: The foaled animal trotted gracefully across the field.
